false_statements.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
false_statements.statement: Iran will have nuclear weapons capability within 3-5 years
false_statements.context: Speaking to the Israeli Knesset in 1992, Netanyahu warned that Iran would become autonomous in developing nuclear weapons within this timeframe. He repeated similar warnings throughout the 1990s in his book 'Fighting Terrorism' and various speeches.

false_statements.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
false_statements.statement: Iraq is advancing towards nuclear weapons with centrifuges the size of washing machines
false_statements.context: Testifying before the US Congress in 2002, Netanyahu claimed Iraq had an advanced nuclear program with large-scale centrifuge operations. This was used to support arguments for military intervention in Iraq.

false_statements.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
false_statements.statement: Iran has a secret nuclear warehouse storing massive amounts of equipment in Tehran
false_statements.context: In his 2018 UN General Assembly speech, Netanyahu revealed what he described as a secret nuclear facility storing equipment from Iran's nuclear program. US intelligence officials later told reporters this claim was misleading.

false_statements.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
false_statements.statement: By next spring, at most by next summer, Iran will finish medium enrichment and move to final stage
false_statements.context: Speaking at the UN General Assembly while holding a cartoon bomb drawing, Netanyahu warned that Iran was on the verge of completing its nuclear weapons program within months.

false_statements.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
false_statements.statement: Iran could produce a nuclear weapon in a very short time - months, even weeks
false_statements.context: Shortly before launching Operation Rising Lion against Iran's nuclear facilities, Netanyahu claimed Iran was on the immediate verge of nuclear weapons capability, contradicting US intelligence assessments.

false_statements.name: Ali Khamenei
false_statements.statement: I have issued a fatwa declaring nuclear weapons religiously forbidden under Islamic law
false_statements.context: Iranian officials, particularly Hassan Rouhani, have repeatedly cited Khamenei's nuclear fatwa as evidence Iran will never pursue nuclear weapons. However, research shows no written fatwa was ever published on Khamenei's official websites.

false_statements.name: Ali Khamenei
false_statements.statement: Iran's nuclear program is entirely for peaceful purposes and civilian energy production
false_statements.context: Throughout decades of nuclear development, Khamenei has consistently claimed Iran's nuclear activities are solely for peaceful energy and medical purposes, while Iran enriched uranium to 60% purity - far beyond civilian needs.

false_statements.name: Ali Khamenei
false_statements.statement: We do not want nuclear weapons and have never pursued them
false_statements.context: Speaking at various public events, Khamenei has categorically denied Iran's pursuit of nuclear weapons capability, while intelligence documents stolen by Israel revealed Iran's past nuclear weapons research program (Project AMAD).

false_statements.name: Ali Khamenei
false_statements.statement: Nuclear weapons have no place in Iran's military system
false_statements.context: Khamenei has repeatedly stated that nuclear weapons are not part of Iran's defense strategy, while Iran developed ballistic missiles capable of carrying nuclear warheads and advanced its uranium enrichment capabilities.

false_statements.name: Ali Khamenei
false_statements.statement: If it were not an Islamic principle, we would build nuclear weapons and no one could stop us
false_statements.context: Speaking to nuclear industry officials, Khamenei simultaneously claimed religious prohibition while boasting of Iran's technical capabilities, revealing the conditional nature of Iran's nuclear restraint.

false_statements.name: Barack Obama
false_statements.statement: I didn't set a red line on Syria chemical weapons - the world set a red line
false_statements.context: When questioned about his failure to act after Assad's chemical weapons use, Obama claimed he never personally established the 'red line,' contradicting his explicit 2012 statement that chemical weapons use would be 'a red line for us.'

false_statements.name: Barack Obama
false_statements.statement: A red line for us is we start seeing a whole bunch of chemical weapons moving around or being utilized
false_statements.context: Obama's impromptu red line statement was made without consulting advisers and created expectations of military response that he later failed to fulfill when Assad used chemical weapons at Ghouta, killing 1,400 people.

false_statements.name: Barack Obama
false_statements.statement: The Iran nuclear deal will prevent Iran from obtaining nuclear weapons
false_statements.context: Obama promoted the JCPOA as a permanent solution to Iran's nuclear threat, while the deal contained sunset clauses that would allow Iran to resume advanced nuclear activities after 2025-2030.

false_statements.name: Barack Obama
false_statements.statement: We have successfully removed Syria's chemical weapons through diplomacy
false_statements.context: Obama claimed the 2013 diplomatic agreement with Russia successfully eliminated Syria's chemical weapons threat, while Assad continued using chlorine and other chemical agents throughout the Syrian civil war.

false_statements.name: Barack Obama
false_statements.statement: Iran's Supreme Leader has indicated there is a fatwa which forbids nuclear weapons development
false_statements.context: Obama repeatedly referenced Khamenei's supposed nuclear fatwa during negotiations and public statements, lending credibility to a religious ruling that expert analysis suggests may not exist in formal written form.

false_statements.name: Donald Trump
false_statements.statement: Maximum pressure will force Iran back to the negotiating table for a better deal
false_statements.context: Trump promised his sanctions campaign would pressure Iran into accepting a more comprehensive nuclear agreement, while Iran instead accelerated its nuclear program and enriched uranium to near-weapons grade levels.

false_statements.name: Donald Trump
false_statements.statement: Iran's oil exports were driven to zero during my presidency
false_statements.context: Trump repeatedly claimed he eliminated Iran's oil revenue, while Iran continued selling significant quantities of oil through sanctions evasion networks, particularly to China.

false_statements.name: Donald Trump
false_statements.statement: There would never have been an October 7 if I had remained president
false_statements.context: Trump claimed his Iran policy prevented Hamas from being funded and would have prevented the October 7 attack, while Hamas received funding from multiple sources and had been planning the attack for years.

false_statements.name: Donald Trump
false_statements.statement: The Iran nuclear deal was the worst deal ever negotiated
false_statements.context: Trump consistently characterized the JCPOA as catastrophically bad while it successfully limited Iran's nuclear activities, with IAEA confirming Iran's compliance until the US withdrawal.

false_statements.name: Donald Trump
false_statements.statement: Maximum pressure contains Iran and reduces regional threats
false_statements.context: Trump argued his sanctions policy reduced Iranian threats, while Iran expanded its proxy networks, increased missile production, and advanced its nuclear program beyond JCPOA limits during his pressure campaign.

false_statements.name: Hassan Rouhani
false_statements.statement: The nuclear fatwa is more important for us than the NPT
false_statements.context: As Iran's chief nuclear negotiator, Rouhani promoted Khamenei's supposed fatwa as binding religious law preventing nuclear weapons development, while later admitting he introduced the fatwa concept as a negotiating tactic without prior coordination.

false_statements.name: Hassan Rouhani
false_statements.statement: Iran has never violated its nuclear commitments under international agreements
false_statements.context: Rouhani claimed Iran maintained its international nuclear obligations, while Iran was secretly developing nuclear weapons capabilities through the AMAD Project and later violated JCPOA enrichment limits.

false_statements.name: Hassan Rouhani
false_statements.statement: Iran's nuclear program faces no legal or technical obstacles to peaceful development
false_statements.context: Rouhani argued Iran's nuclear activities were entirely legitimate and faced only political opposition, while Iran was concealing military dimensions of its nuclear program from international inspectors.

false_statements.name: Hassan Rouhani
false_statements.statement: The JCPOA ensures Iran's nuclear rights while building international confidence
false_statements.context: Rouhani promoted the nuclear deal as protecting Iran's rights while satisfying international concerns, but Iran continued developing advanced centrifuges and maintaining nuclear weapons knowledge during JCPOA implementation.

false_statements.name: Hassan Rouhani
false_statements.statement: Iran disclosed all aspects of its nuclear program to international inspectors
false_statements.context: Rouhani claimed full transparency with the IAEA, while Iran maintained undeclared nuclear sites and activities, as revealed by Israeli intelligence operations and subsequent IAEA investigations.
